availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Thornton C. Pattie (Hancock County master carpenter)

body.p: A Kentucky master carpenter. Lived in Hancock County in 1860. Married to Julietta Ann Cooper Pattie, Father of Josie Pattie. Member of the Masonic Order at Hancock Lodge, No. 115 in Hawesville, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Hancock County, Hawesville, p. 125; "Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Kentucky, 1850," (http://www.latinamericanstudies.org/freemasonry/Proceedings-KY-1850.pdf), 83-84; Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of kentucky, at a Grand Annual Communication, in the City of Louisville, Commencing on Monday, the 21st Day of October, 1867 (Frankfort, Ky.: Frankfort Commonwealth, 1867), 111-112.
